intro: Medicago lupulina subsp. secundiflora, commonly known as the secondary-flowered sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial legume characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has trifoliate leaves with narrow, pointed leaflets and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in forage systems. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by bees and other insects.
